communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. Suspensions issued by schools in the 2025-2026 school year.

Provide the name of the school and break down the data by student ethnicity/race and grade.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. Anonymized data of all school transfers of CPS students from the start of the 2025/2026 school year to December 31, 2025. These records should include a unique non-identifiable code for the student, the original school, the receiving school, and the month and year of transfer.

Include the transfer code in the above-requested data table:
1. 33 - Transfer Outside of Chicago
2. 86 - Unable to Locate
3. 31 - Transfer within CPS
4. 32- Transfer to non-public
5. 52 - Program Ended, PreK or K
6. 40 - Homeschooled
7. 35 - Legally Committed to an Institution
8. 87 - 17 or >, Cons to Wthd

If the student transferred via Code 33, include the receiving school. Note if it's a verified transfer or not.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.  The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS LRE Distribution
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Case managers in local schools can run reports. CPS officials can also run reports on specific schools.

Please provide the following:

A report showing the LRE distribution in Courtenay Elementary school by homeroom.

A report showing the LRE distribution in Funston Elementary school by homeroom.

A report showing the LRE distribution in Mount Greenwood school by homeroom.

I am not looking for student specific information. I am only seeking Least Restrictive Environment information. This can be provided in aggregate or disaggregated. There should be a column listing Least Restrictive Environment by 1, 2 or 3. I do not want anonymized student IDs but one row of data should correspond to one student (if produced in disaggregated form). 

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani
